metadata.title: CVE-2021-38491 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Mixed-content checks were unable to analyze opaque origins which led to some mixed content being loaded. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 92.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-38491` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '92.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
